The answer is A: She begins by declaring an ambition to create an indigenous cryptocurrency, then recognizes the risks of digitizing sacred knowledge and reframes the problem around cultural safety. She introduces Āhau as a values-led, data-sovereign storehouse, later situating Indigicoin as just one part of a broader platform stack. She concludes by emphasizing rigorous security, inviting experts to test and harden the system.

This answer is based on the information provided in the video clips. The speaker starts by discussing the creation of an indigenous cryptocurrency, which is mentioned in the title of the talk. However, she then shifts the focus to the risks associated with digitizing sacred knowledge and introduces Āhau as a platform that prioritizes cultural safety. Later, she mentions Indigicoin as a part of a broader platform stack, and concludes by emphasizing the importance of security and inviting experts to test and harden the system. This progression aligns with option A.
